bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, August 31, 1940

div1.p: Truby hopes to hear from Hench. He gives Hench permission to quote him.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, August 31, 1940

opener.dateline:
ALBERT E. TRUBY
145 LAUREL STREET
SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA
Aug. 31, 1940

div1.p:
I have your letter of Aug. 3d,
but since then I have heard nothing
and am apprehensive that you
may have written me, but that
the letter has gone astray.

You did not tell me the date
for the dedication ceremonies at
Washington & Jefferson University. I hope
it is still some time in the future.

I have a letter from General Kean in
which he states that he sees no reason
why you should not use the
information I gave you about the
difficulties Reed had in concluding
what to say about Lazear's infection.

Therefore you are welcome to use
it if you so desire. I do not
know what other ideas have developed
about that point, but what I gave
you is not second handed and is
the true one. Won't you please relieve

my anxiety and advise me
what has happened.
